title: Dow Jones Slashes 225-Point Gain Amid Trump Comments And Civil Unrest; Apple In Buy Zone
summary:
Dow Jones stock Apple remains in a new buy area after Monday's decisive move, as the current stock market rally continues.
Dow Jones Today: Trump Comments On Civil UnrestThe Nasdaq composite moved down 0.3% Tuesday midday.
Current Stock Market RallyAccording to IBD's The Big Picture, the stock market uptrend remains solid after hitting lows more than two months ago on March 23.
Dow Jones Leaders: MicrosoftAmong the top Dow Jones stocks, tech giant Microsoft fell 0.5% Tuesday morning.
The software leader is approaching a new 187.61 buy point amid a slow-going breakout move above a cup-with-handle's 180.10 buy point.
text:
The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped as much as 236 points before cutting gains early Tuesday following President Trump's comments, as civil unrest continued across the United States. Dow Jones stock Apple remains in a new buy area after Monday's decisive move, as the current stock market rally continues.

X

Apple (AAPL) fell 0.5% after cutting iPhone prices in China, while Microsoft (MSFT) also lost 0.5% in today's stock market. Breakout stocks to watch are Applied Materials (AMAT), Domino's Pizza (DPZ) and Tesla (TSLA). Coronavirus stock leader Zoom Video (ZM) jumped as much as 4.2% before falling about 1% ahead of its earnings results after the close.

Dow Jones Today: Trump Comments On Civil Unrest

The Nasdaq composite moved down 0.3% Tuesday midday. At around 11:45 a.m. ET, the S&P 500 trimmed gains to 0.2%, while the Dow Jones industrials outperformed with a 0.6% gain.

Late Monday, President Trump promised an assertive response to the ongoing protests across the country, threatening potential military action. President Trump said, "I am mobilizing all federal and local resources, civilian and military, to protect the rights of law-abiding Americans. If a city or state refuses to take the actions necessary to defend the life and property of their residents, then I will deploy the United States military and quickly solve the problem for them."

Among exchange traded funds, Innovator IBD 50 (FFTY) fell 0.8%. The ETF of top growth stocks is about 14% off its 52-week high. Meanwhile, the Nasdaq 100-linked Invesco QQQ Trust ETF (QQQ) traded down 0.45%, and the SPDR S&P 500 (SPY) ETF was up 0.2%.

Within the coronavirus stock market rally, the tech-heavy Nasdaq is once again positive for 2020, up 6.5% through Monday's close. Meanwhile, the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average are down 5.4% and 10.7%, respectively, through June 1.

IBD Live: A New Tool For Daily Stock Market Analysis

Coronavirus News: U.S. Cases Top 1.8 Million

The coronavirus outbreak continues to spread across the U.S. According to the Worldometer data tracker, the cumulative number of confirmed U.S. cases exceeded 1.8 million. Despite the rising total, the daily number of new cases is trending lower.

Confirmed Covid-19 cases worldwide climbed to near 6.4 million, with about 337,000 virus-related deaths. With the daily number of new cases still on the decline, investors in the U.S. are turning attention to the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak and how fast the country reopens for business.

Current Stock Market Rally

According to IBD's The Big Picture, the stock market uptrend remains solid after hitting lows more than two months ago on March 23. The major stock indexes confirmed a new uptrend on April 2.

Per Monday's Big Picture, "The tech-heavy Nasdaq's nearly 0.7% advance is quite impressive considering the negative headlines brewing in the U.S.-China relationship and amid the protests and uncontrolled looting gripping America's biggest cities following the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis a week ago. Monday's gain followed gains of 3.4% and 1.8% by the Nasdaq composite in the prior two weeks."

Stocks to watch include the top stocks on IBD Long-Term Leaders. The IBD Long-Term Leaders list focuses on companies with stable earnings growth and price performance.

Stock Market ETF Strategy And How To Invest In The Current Uptrend

Dow Jones News: Apple Cuts iPhone Prices

Among the Dow Jones stocks, Apple moved down 0.5% after cutting prices on its latest iPhones in China ahead of the country's big online shopping event on June 18.

Apple stock is in buy range after decisively clearing a handle's 319.79 buy point, which offers an add-on entry. Shares are still above the buy point. The entry is an opportunity for investors to add to their positions amid the breakout move past a cup-with-handle's 288.35 buy point, according to MarketSmith chart analysis.

Shares are just 2% off their all-time highs, nearly completing a remarkable recovery from the coronavirus stock market crash.

Breakout Stocks To Watch: Applied Materials, Domino's, Tesla

Monday's IBD 50 Stocks To Watch pick, Applied Materials, is adding a handle to a cup base, making the new buy point 58.26. Shares are about 5% away from the correct entry amid Tuesday's 0.9% fall.

According to the IBD Stock Checkup, AMAT stock shows a 94 out of a highest-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating, placing it in the upper echelon of growth stocks. The Composite Rating — an easy way to identify top growth stocks — is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics to help investors easily gauge a stock's strengths.

Applied Materials was also featured in this week's Stocks Near A Buy Zone column.

IBD Leaderboard stock Domino's Pizza broke out Monday past a 388.05 buy point in a new flat base, but failed to hold its gains. Shares were up 0.4% Tuesday morning and are below the buy point. The 5% buy zone tops out at 407.45.

On the downside, the stock's RS line remains relatively far from its previous highs. Ideally, the stock's RS line should hit a new high on the breakout day or shortly thereafter.

Tesla traded in the 5% buy zone early Tuesday above a 869.92 buy point in a cup with handle. The 5% buy zone tops out at 913.42. Shares moved down 1.4% in morning trade.

Tesla was added back to the IBD Leaderboard Leaders list Monday after the strong breakout. According to IBD Leaderboard commentary, "Tesla broke out above a handle on an extra-deep cup base. It is trading above a trend line within the handle that offers an aggressive entry near 828. It is a quarter position."

Stock Market News: Zoom Earnings

Coronavirus stock leader Zoom Video will report its quarterly earnings results after the close Tuesday. Analysts see Zoom Video earnings soaring 200% to 9 cents a share, with revenue surging 81% to $202 million.

Zoom stock rallied as much as 4.2% early Tuesday to hit more all-time highs before falling about 1% in morning trade. On Monday, Zoom Video surged 13.75% to new highs. Shares rallied more than 94% above a 107.44 buy point in a cup base after three separate tests of their 50-day moving average line.

Dow Jones Leaders: Microsoft

Among the top Dow Jones stocks, tech giant Microsoft fell 0.5% Tuesday morning. The software leader is approaching a new 187.61 buy point amid a slow-going breakout move above a cup-with-handle's 180.10 buy point.

Microsoft is also an IBD Leaderboard stock idea and an IBD Long-Term Leader.

Be sure to follow Scott Lehtonen on Twitter at @IBD_SLehtonen for more on growth stocks and the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

<li><a href="https://www.investors.com/category/market-trend/stock-market-today/" rel="category tag">Stock Market Today</a></li></ul> <h1 class="header1">
Dow Jones Cuts 236-Point Gain Amid Trump Comments, As Civil Unrest Continues; Apple Cuts iPhone Prices	</h1>
<div class="featured-post-image-container"></div>
<div class="addtoany_share_save_container addtoany_content_top row">
<div class="share">
<div class="a2a_kit a2a_kit_size_25 addtoany_list" data-a2a-url="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-today/dow-jones-trump-comments-civil-unrest-apple-stock-zoom-video-earnings/" data-a2a-title="Dow Jones Cuts 236-Point Gain Amid Trump Comments, As Civil Unrest Continues; Apple Cuts iPhone Prices"><a class="a2a_button_facebook" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/facebook?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fmarket-trend%2Fstock-market-today%2Fdow-jones-trump-comments-civil-unrest-apple-stock-zoom-video-earnings%2F&linkname=Dow%20Jones%20Cuts%20236-Point%20Gain%20Amid%20Trump%20Comments%2C%20As%20Civil%20Unrest%20Continues%3B%20Apple%20Cuts%20iPhone%20Prices" title="Facebook" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/facebook.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Facebook"></a><a class="a2a_button_twitter" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/twitter?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fmarket-trend%2Fstock-market-today%2Fdow-jones-trump-comments-civil-unrest-apple-stock-zoom-video-earnings%2F&linkname=Dow%20Jones%20Cuts%20236-Point%20Gain%20Amid%20Trump%20Comments%2C%20As%20Civil%20Unrest%20Continues%3B%20Apple%20Cuts%20iPhone%20Prices" title="Twitter" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/twitter.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Twitter"></a><a class="a2a_button_linkedin" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/linkedin?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fmarket-trend%2Fstock-market-today%2Fdow-jones-trump-comments-civil-unrest-apple-stock-zoom-video-earnings%2F&linkname=Dow%20Jones%20Cuts%20236-Point%20Gain%20Amid%20Trump%20Comments%2C%20As%20Civil%20Unrest%20Continues%3B%20Apple%20Cuts%20iPhone%20Prices" title="LinkedIn" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/linkedin.png" width="25" height="25" alt="LinkedIn"></a><a class="a2a_dd addtoany_share_save addtoany_share" href="https://www.addtoany.com/share"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/email.png" alt="Share"></a></div> <a class="reprints-button sharing" href="https://www.ibdlicensing.com" target="_blank">Licensing</a>
</div>
<ul class="post-meta">
<li><span class="authors-links"><a href="https://www.investors.com/author/lehtonens/" title="Posts by SCOTT LEHTONEN" class="author url fn" rel="author">SCOTT LEHTONEN</a></span></li>
<li class="post-time">11:45 AM ET 06/02/2020</li>
</ul>
</div>
</header>
<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p>The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped as much as 236 points before cutting gains early Tuesday following President Trump's comments, as civil unrest continued across the United States. <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/dow-jones-stocks/">Dow Jones stock</a> Apple remains in a new buy area after Monday's decisive move, as the current stock market rally continues.</p>
<span>
<span style="width:50%;" class="video-player-container vms-left">
<span class="shortcode-video" vid-id="5887716" vid-dom-id="5887716-5ed709a3bbbb5" vid-top="false" vid-repeat="1" vid-width="50" vid-url="https://content.jwplatform.com/manifests/WCjWflz0.m3u8" data-captions="[{"name":"English","url":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/tracks\/0TjeJs66"}]" vid-name="Rally Won't Back Down; Recovery Stocks Trade Desk, RH, Carvana Spike" vid-cat="Stock Market Today" vid-date="06/02/2020" vid-image="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/WCjWflz0-640x360.jpg" vid-authors="ALISSA CORAM, Ed Carson">
<span class="close-mini-vid">X</span>
<span id="shortcode-video-player-5887716-5ed709a3bbbb5" class="ready-to-load"></span>
</span>
</span>
</span><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Rally Won't Back Down; Recovery Stocks Trade Desk, RH, Carvana Spike","description":"Rally won't back down; Economic recovery stocks Trade Desk, RH, Carvana spike.","thumbnailUrl":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/WCjWflz0-640x360.jpg","contentUrl":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/manifests\/WCjWflz0.m3u8","uploadDate":"2020-06-02T13:40:55+0000","duration":"PT457.00S","author":"ALISSA CORAM, Ed Carson","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Investor's Business Daily","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/ibd-logo.png"},"url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com"},"keywords":""}</script>
<p><strong>Apple</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL' target='_blank'>AAPL</a>) fell 0.5% after cutting iPhone prices in China, while <strong>Microsoft</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MSFT' target='_blank'>MSFT</a>) also lost 0.5% in <a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-today/stock-market-today-market-trends-best-stocks-buy-watch/">today's stock market.</a> Breakout stocks to watch are <strong>Applied</strong> <strong>Materials</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AMAT' target='_blank'>AMAT</a>), <strong>Domino's Pizza</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=DPZ' target='_blank'>DPZ</a>) and <strong>Tesla</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=TSLA' target='_blank'>TSLA</a>). Coronavirus stock leader <strong>Zoom Video</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=ZM' target='_blank'>ZM</a>) jumped as much as 4.2% before falling about 1% ahead of its earnings results after the close.</p>
<h2>Dow Jones Today: Trump Comments On Civil Unrest</h2>
<p>The <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/stock-market-data-dow-jones-sp-500-nasdaq-spdr-etfs/">Nasdaq composite</a> moved down 0.3% Tuesday midday. At around 11:45 a.m. ET, the S&P 500 trimmed gains to 0.2%, while the Dow Jones industrials outperformed with a 0.6% gain.</p>
<p>Late Monday, President Trump promised an assertive response to the ongoing protests across the country, threatening potential military action. President Trump said, "I am mobilizing all federal and local resources, civilian and military, to protect the rights of law-abiding Americans. If a city or state refuses to take the actions necessary to defend the life and property of their residents, then I will deploy the United States military and quickly solve the problem for them."</p>
<script type="text/javascript">

<div class="investors-tickers-data-table" id="investors-tickers-data-table-4752222-1591151011"></div>
<p>Among <a href="https://www.investors.com/ibd-indexes/ibd-etf-indexes-ibd-50-etf-leaders-breakout-stocks-etf-ffty-ldrs-bout/">exchange traded funds</a>, Innovator IBD 50 (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=FFTY' target='_blank'>FFTY</a>) fell 0.8%. The ETF of top growth stocks is about 14% off its 52-week high. Meanwhile, the Nasdaq 100-linked Invesco QQQ Trust ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=QQQ' target='_blank'>QQQ</a>) traded down 0.45%, and the SPDR S&P 500 (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=SPY' target='_blank'>SPY</a>) ETF was up 0.2%.</p>
<p>Within the coronavirus stock market rally, the tech-heavy Nasdaq is once again positive for 2020, up 6.5% through Monday's close. Meanwhile, the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average are down 5.4% and 10.7%, respectively, through June 1.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong><a href="https://shop.investors.com/offer/splashresponsive.aspx?id=IBD-Live&src=A00433A&refcode=pdsoc%7Cggl%7Cibdlive%7C2019%7C11%7Cibdlive%7Cna%7C985802&intcode=invstcntnartcls|cms|ibdlive|2019|11|ibdlive|na|682843">IBD Live: A New Tool For Daily Stock Market Analysis</a></strong></p>
<hr />
<h2>Coronavirus News: U.S. Cases Top 1.8 Million</h2>
<p>The coronavirus outbreak continues to spread across the U.S. According to the <a href="https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Worldometer data tracker</a>, the cumulative number of confirmed U.S. cases exceeded 1.8 million. Despite the rising total, the daily number of new cases is trending lower.</p>
<p>Confirmed Covid-19 cases worldwide climbed to near 6.4 million, with about 337,000 virus-related deaths. With the daily number of new cases still on the decline, investors in the U.S. are turning attention to the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak and how fast the country reopens for business.</p>
<h2>Current Stock Market Rally</h2>
<p>According to IBD's <a href="https://www.investors.com/category/market-trend/the-big-picture/">The Big Picture</a>, the stock market uptrend remains solid after hitting lows more than two months ago on March 23. The major stock indexes confirmed a new uptrend on April 2.</p>
<p>Per <a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/the-big-picture/nasdaq-gains-these-indexes-outperform-three-reasons-trend-bullish/">Monday's Big Picture</a>, "The tech-heavy Nasdaq's nearly 0.7% advance is quite impressive considering the negative headlines brewing in the U.S.-China relationship and amid the protests and uncontrolled looting gripping America's biggest cities following the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis a week ago. Monday's gain followed gains of 3.4% and 1.8% by the Nasdaq composite in the prior two weeks."</p>
<p>Stocks to watch include the top stocks on <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">IBD Long-Term Leaders</a>. The IBD Long-Term Leaders list focuses on companies with stable earnings growth and price performance.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/ibds-etf-market-strategy/ibds-etf-market-strategy/"><strong>Stock Market ETF Strategy And How To Invest In The Current Uptrend</strong></a></p>
<hr />
<h2>Dow Jones News: Apple Cuts iPhone Prices</h2>
<p>Among the Dow Jones stocks, Apple moved down 0.5% after cutting prices on its latest iPhones in China ahead of the country's big online shopping event on June 18.</p>
<p>Apple stock is in buy range after decisively clearing a handle's 319.79 buy point, which offers an add-on entry. Shares are still above the buy point. The entry is an opportunity for investors to add to their positions amid the breakout move past a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-buy-stocks-cup-with-handle-base-alibaba-stock-buy-point/">cup-with-handle's</a> 288.35 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/chart-reading-basics-how-a-buy-point-marks-a-time-of-opportunity/">buy point</a>, according to <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith">MarketSmith chart analysis</a>.</p>
<p>Shares are just 2% off their all-time highs, nearly completing a remarkable recovery from the coronavirus stock market crash.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns medium-6 leftchart"><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=TSLA'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Breakout Stocks To Watch: Applied Materials, Domino's, Tesla</h2>
<p><a href="https://www.investors.com/research/amat-stock-breakout-could-be-in-cards-for-ibd-50-chip-leader/">Monday's IBD 50 Stocks To Watch pick</a>, Applied Materials, is adding a handle to a cup base, making the new buy point 58.26. Shares are about 5% away from the correct entry amid Tuesday's 0.9% fall.</p>
<p>According to the <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/">IBD Stock Checkup</a>, <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/nasdaq-applied-materials-inc-amat.aspx">AMAT stock</a> shows a 94 out of a highest-possible 99 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-research-growth-stocks/">IBD Composite Rating</a>, placing it in the upper echelon of growth stocks. The Composite Rating — an easy way to identify top growth stocks — is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics to help investors easily gauge a stock's strengths.</p>
<p>Applied Materials <a href="https://www.investors.com/stock-lists/stocks-near-a-buy-zone/stocks-to-watch-netflix-stock-tesla-stock-breaking-out-applied-materials-stock/">was also featured</a> in this week's <a href="https://www.investors.com/category/stock-lists/stocks-near-a-buy-zone/">Stocks Near A Buy Zone</a> column.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.investors.com/product/leaderboard/?artProdLink=Leaderboard">IBD Leaderboard</a> stock Domino's Pizza broke out Monday past a 388.05 buy point in a new flat base, but failed to hold its gains. Shares were up 0.4% Tuesday morning and are below the buy point. The 5% buy zone tops out at 407.45.</p>
<p>On the downside, the stock's RS line remains relatively far from its previous highs. Ideally, the stock's RS line should hit a new high on the breakout day or shortly thereafter.</p>
<p>Tesla traded in the 5% buy zone early Tuesday above a 869.92 buy point in a cup with handle. The 5% buy zone tops out at 913.42. Shares moved down 1.4% in morning trade.</p>
<p>Tesla was added back to the <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/leaderboard/?artProdLink=Leaderboard">IBD Leaderboard Leaders list</a> Monday after the strong breakout. According to IBD Leaderboard commentary, "Tesla broke out above a handle on an extra-deep cup base. It is trading above a trend line within the handle that offers an aggressive entry near 828. It is a quarter position."</p>
<h2>Stock Market News: Zoom Earnings</h2>
<p>Coronavirus stock leader Zoom Video will report its <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/technology/zoom-video-earnings-zm-stock-q12020/">quarterly earnings results</a> after the close Tuesday. Analysts see Zoom Video earnings soaring 200% to 9 cents a share, with revenue surging 81% to $202 million.</p>
<p>Zoom stock rallied as much as 4.2% early Tuesday to hit more all-time highs before falling about 1% in morning trade. On Monday, Zoom Video surged 13.75% to new highs. Shares rallied more than 94% above a 107.44 buy point in a cup base after three separate tests of their 50-day moving average line.</p>
<h2>Dow Jones Leaders: Microsoft</h2>
<div class="small-12 columns medium-6 leftchart"><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=MSFT'></iframe></div></div>
<p>Among the <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/dow-jones-stocks/">top Dow Jones stocks</a>, tech giant Microsoft fell 0.5% Tuesday morning. The software leader is approaching a new 187.61 buy point amid a slow-going breakout move above a cup-with-handle's 180.10 buy point.</p>
<p>Microsoft is also an <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/leaderboard/?artProdLink=Leaderboard">IBD Leaderboard</a> stock idea and an <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">IBD Long-Term Leader</a>.</p>
